Specific Details: Galway City draft development plan 2023 to 2029. I put together and submitted a document outlining the sport of archery and how it might be catered to if new sports facilities, indoor and outdoor, are developed as part of the plan.
DPOs Lobbied: Michael John Crowe|Councillor|Galway City Council::Mike Cubbard|Councillor|Galway City Council::Frank Fahy|Councillor|Galway City Council::Peter Keane|Councillor|Galway City Council::Noel Larkin|Councillor|Galway City Council::Donal Lyons|Councillor|Galway City Council::Declan McDonnell|Councillor|Galway City Council::Niall McNelis|Councillor|Galway City Council::Terry O'Flaherty|Councillor|Galway City Council::Brendan McGrath|CEO|Galway City Council::Colette Connolly|Councillor|Galway City Council::Alan Cheevers|Councillor|Galway City Council::Clodagh Higgins|Councillor|Galway City Council::Eddie Hoare|Councillor|Galway City Council::John Connolly|Councillor|Galway City Council::Martina O'Connor|Councillor|Galway City Council::Owen Hanley|Councillor|Galway City Council::Imelda Byrne|Councillor|Galway City Council::Niall Murphy|Councillor|Galway City Council
Subject Matter: Galway City draft development plan 2023 to 2029. I put together and submitted a document outlining the sport of archery and how it might be catered to if new sports facilities, indoor and outdoor, are developed as part of the plan.
Intended Results: A conversation with Galway City Council leading to the recognition of archery as an active sport within the city, in the hope that archery is considered in the development of new facilities and is permitted to use existing facilities. Archery and other small sports are not typically involved in consultation when facilities are being developed or opened for use. Many feel that this is because we are not well established and do not have a groundswell of political or community support.
Lobbying Activities: A copy of the formal submission made under the draft development plan was emailed to all Galway City Councillors. This email was sent once only to each councillor.|Email|1

Specific Details: Informed public about zoning of recreational and amenity land in Merlin Woods for specific development and asked them to ask ther councillors why this decision was taken .Contacted councillor Alan Cheevers to ask why he had changed his mind about protecting the woodlands , spoke to Cllr Owen Hanley about the decision made to understand what had happened
DPOs Lobbied: Michael John Crowe|Councillor|Galway City Council::Mike Cubbard|Councillor|Galway City Council::Frank Fahy|Councillor|Galway City Council::Peter Keane|Councillor|Galway City Council::Noel Larkin|Councillor|Galway City Council::Donal Lyons|Councillor|Galway City Council::Declan McDonnell|Councillor|Galway City Council::Niall McNelis|Councillor|Galway City Council::Terry O'Flaherty|Councillor|Galway City Council::Colette Connolly|Councillor|Galway City Council::Alan Cheevers|Councillor|Galway City Council::Clodagh Higgins|Councillor|Galway City Council::Eddie Hoare|Councillor|Galway City Council::John Connolly|Councillor|Galway City Council::Martina O'Connor|Councillor|Galway City Council::Owen Hanley|Councillor|Galway City Council::Imelda Byrne|Councillor|Galway City Council::Niall Murphy|Councillor|Galway City Council
Subject Matter: Informed public about zoning of recreational and amenity land in Merlin Woods for specific development and asked them to ask ther councillors why this decision was taken .Contacted councillor Alan Cheevers to ask why he had changed his mind about protecting the woodlands , spoke to Cllr Owen Hanley about the decision made to understand what had happened
Intended Results: Awareness of change to environmental and amenity land that will affect publc and that councillors would know the importance of this land to the public
Lobbying Activities:
Used our groups  Facebook , Twittr and Instagram to raise awareness of the specific rzoning to inform the community and asked peolple to ask the councillors who voted for this  why 
Spoke to Cllr Owen Hanley to understand the decision made 
Spoke to Cllr Alan Cheevers to ask why he had voted for specific zonng|Social Media|6-10
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Caroline Stanley on behalf of  Friends of Merlin Woods community
Grassroots directive: ask community to ask councillors why they rezoned this land
